newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian metals mixed in light trade.
newsitem.headline: Indian metals mixed in light trade.

text.p: Indian copper, zinc and aluminium extended gains on Tuesday while other base metals were steady in limited trade, dealers said.
Ready copper rose 25 rupees to 13,550 rupees per quintal on limited supplies and rising global prices, they said.
"Reports that the state-owned Hindustan Copper Ltd. has hiked selling prices of copper wire bar by 2,000 rupees per tonne for April also aided the firm trend," one dealer said.
Zinc firmed up by 50 rupees to 7,850 rupees per quintal on shortage of ready stock while the uptrend in the world market strenghtened speculative support, dealers said.
Zinc was up 100 rupees per quintal last week.
Aluminium rose 25 rupees to 7,450 rupees per quintal on stray enquiries while nickel was steady at 36,800 rupees per quintal after losing 500 rupees last week, dealers said.
Other metals were steady in limited trade with tin at 31,600 rupees per quintal and lead at 4,550 rupees.
